item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I’m going to lock this because, for all intents and purposes (after reading through this entire thread), it is by no means an intellectual discussion or debate, and has boiled down after 10 pages to “YOU CAN’T PROVE HE EXISTS” AND “YOU CAN’T PROVE HE DOESN’T”.

Read full topic
item.source: The Theory of GOD IS loveING

item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:140, topic:469198”][quote author=Black Not link=topic=586291.msg4178319#msg4178319 date=1355239525]
Jesus existed and was the equivalent to today’s Derren Brown. A trickster. People were just too naive in them days (has anyone seen Life of Brian?).

Fuck “god” and all who praise him. Saying stuff like “hmm, well im nt sure but i believe in god cuz my parents brought me up like dat”, stop being so delusional and think for yourself for once. Stop living in denial because religion is the root of all evil.
[/quote]

Who made you? Who made them? Who made them? This cycle will continue till you reach the first woman on earth? Now, who made that woman? God.

something can’t come from nothing.

God tells us that He is the only creator and sustainer of all that exists. He tells us that He is not created, nor is He like His creation in anyway. He calls Himself by a number of names and three of them are:

A) The First
B) The Last
C) The Eternal, who is sought after by His creation, while He has no need from them at all.

He always has existed and He never was created, as He is not like His creation, nor similar to it, in any way.[/quote]

How do you know it was god who said this? You don’t even know if God exists, how can you know what he said?

You claim that the universe has a creator, because a story must have a beginning. Then you go on to say that God doesn’t need a beginning. You discredit others with an argument that discredits yourself. Twisted and wishful thinking.

If god doesn’t need a creator, than the universe doesn’t need a creator either.

[quote=“Cole1497, post:176, topic:469198”][quote author=ciaran6889 link=topic=586291.msg4181026#msg4181026 date=1355530564]

god doesn’t exist, get over it.

prove it.
[/quote]
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russell’s_teapot[/quote]
+1.
America will never understand this. Not until they have a better education system.

Read full topic
item.source: The Theory of GOD IS loveING

item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“ciaran6889, post:173, topic:469198”][quote author=t4 link=topic=586291.msg4181025#msg4181025 date=1355530506]
god doesn’t exist, get over it.
[/quote]
prove it.[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Russell's teapot

Russell's teapot is an analogy, formulated by the philosopher Bertrand Russell (1872–1970), to illustrate that the philosophic burden of proof lies upon a person making unfalsifiable claims, rather than shifting the burden of disproof to others. Russell specifically applied his analogy in the context of religion. He wrote that if he were to assert, without offering proof, that a teapot orbits the Sun somewhere in space between the Earth and Mars, he could not expect anyone to believe him solely b...

Read full topic

item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:174, topic:469198”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=586291.msg4181014#msg4181014 date=1355528924]

Why are you debating this?It’s just a matter of opinion whether you believe in god or not.There is no evidence he truly does exist or whether he doesn’t.
Unless scientists make a time machine or god appears you cant prove it.

Time is linear, you cannot travel through it. You may alter it’s speed on you, however you cannot travel “though” time.
[/quote]
There is nothing is physics that prevents time travel.[/quote]
Although the presence of time travel (or the possibility of time travel ever being existed) instantly prevents the presence of any free will, ever.

Read full topic

item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Humans have adopted the thinking that everything has a cause and reaction.
Before the universe there was no cause or reaction, simply nothing. The answer to how the universe was created is undoubtedly something that makes no sense at all to the human brain making the logic of god quite logical indeed.

Read full topic
item.source: The Theory of GOD IS loveING

item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:155, topic:469198”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=586291.msg4180380#msg4180380 date=1355445716]

Okay, who made that cell?

why do you assume it’s always a person who made the beginning of everything?
[/quote]
because a story has a beginning to it.[/quote]
Who made God then? If someone had to have made everything, who made God?

Also:

The analogy I use is that the evidence that evolution is occurring, and has been occurring for a very long time, is like seeing an enormous forest fire that has clearly been burning for a long time and left huge evidence of this.

To say that if we don’t know how evolution started then we can conclude that maybe evolution does not exist at all … is like saying that if we don’t know how the forest fire started, then we can conclude that maybe the forest fire doesn’t exist at all!

Read full topic
item.source: The Theory of GOD IS loveING

item.title: The Theory of GOD IS loveING
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:155, topic:469198”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=586291.msg4180380#msg4180380 date=1355445716]

Okay, who made that cell?

why do you assume it’s always a person who made the beginning of everything?
[/quote]
because a story has a beginning to it.[/quote]
Why is life a story? Why can’t we all just exist on our planet in this continuous spectrum of time? If any god existed, why didn’t everyone worship him from the start and write and document all of his actions? There have been thousands of other religions since the modern day accepted ones, so why would the one you believe be the right one?

Gods throughout history explained what we did not understand. For example, the sun was a deity for thousands of years. It provides warm, light, and our existence as a planet. However, islamic scholars discovered around the 8th century it is a star. There hasn’t been a religion since that worships the sun. I believe a ‘grand unified theory’, if it can be executed, will dissolve all religions within 200 years of its creation.

Read full topic
